unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Momentum in Uttar Pradesh**
normalised: smart meter rollout gathers momentum in uttar pradesh

unnormalised: Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh – The Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state as part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS). As of today, 15,000 smart meters have already been installed in Kanpur and Varanasi, with plans to reach 5 lakh installations by 31/12/2024.
normalised: lucknow, uttar pradesh – the U P P C L is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state as part of the revamped distribution sector scheme (R D S S). as of today, fifteen thousand smart meters have already been installed in kanpur and varanasi, with plans to reach five lakh installations by thirty first december two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: These smart meters will enable real-time energy monitoring, reduce Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses, and empower consumers with greater control over their electricity consumption, potentially leading to significant savings on their monthly bills. UPPCL aims to cover all urban areas by 2025, integrating advanced metering infrastructure (AMI) with the state's energy grid.
normalised: these smart meters will enable real-time energy monitoring, reduce aggregate technical and commercial (A T and C) losses, and empower consumers with greater control over their electricity consumption, potentially leading to significant savings on their monthly bills. U P P C L aims to cover all urban areas by two thousand and twenty five, integrating advanced metering infrastructure (A M I) with the state's energy grid.

unnormalised: "This initiative will modernize our power distribution network and improve service delivery for all citizens of Uttar Pradesh," stated Shri. A.K. Sharma, Energy Minister, during a press briefing at 11:00 hrs today. He further added that consumers can access their consumption data via the UPPCL mobile app from 01/10/2024. The project is expected to cost Rs. 20,000 crore and is partially funded by the central government.
normalised: "this initiative will modernize our power distribution network and improve service delivery for all citizens of uttar pradesh," stated shri. A. K. sharma, energy minister, during a press briefing at eleven zero zero hours today. he further added that consumers can access their consumption data via the U P P C L mobile app from first october two thousand and twenty four. the project is expected to cost rupees twenty thousand crore and is partially funded by the central government.
